block.p: Kate George Mattingly, a daughter of Catherine S. Mattingly and George E. Mattingly of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Clayton Frederick Moran, a son of Kate J. Moran of New York and Frederick A. Moran of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. James J. Greenfield performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Washington.
The bride and bridegroom, both 29, graduated from Princeton, she magna cum laude.

Kate George Mattingly, a daughter of Catherine S. Mattingly and George E. Mattingly of Bethesda, Md., was married yesterday to Clayton Frederick Moran, a son of Kate J. Moran of New York and Frederick A. Moran of Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. James J. Greenfield performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Washington.
The bride and bridegroom, both 29, graduated from Princeton, she magna cum laude.

Mrs. Moran is a critic for Dance magazine. She also writes on culture and the arts and teaches dance history at Eliot Feld's Ballet Tech, a dance school in the New York public schools. She received a master's degree in dance performance and choreography from New York University.

Her father is the deputy chief for process measurements at the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Gaithersburg, Md. Her mother is the chairwoman of the English department at the Georgetown Visitation Preparatory School, a Roman Catholic high school in Washington.

Mr. Moran is the chief financial officer of VDC Communications, a long-distance telephone company in Greenwich, Conn., of which his father is the chairman and chief executive. The bridegroom's mother is a corporate identity consultant in New York.
